results.title: Herding cattle on the Niger
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “African village life”.
Illustrates how the West African Peul (or Fulani) tribesmen tend their cattle, wandering from one grazing land to another. Shows them driving their herd across the Niger River. No spoken word. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Hercules (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Hardie Gramatky published in 1940, the most modern of fire engines is forced into retirement because of automation. Illustrated by Hardie Gramatky.

results.title: Hercules (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Alice Dewey, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Zeus and Hera’s son, Hercule’s is stolen by the henchmen of the evil Hades. He manages to survive and is sent to earth to live as a mere mortal, his parents watching from the heavens. Life on earth isn’t happy for Hercules, he’s ridiculed about his strength and nicknamed ‘Jerkules’. On a journey to discover his identity he finds out that he is a son of the gods, but to regain a place in heaven he has to prove himself a hero on earth. The task is not as easy as he first thought, with a beautiful damsel, Meg, manipulated by Hades trying to make him fail. Through attempting to prove himself a hero, Hercules discovers that being famous may gain him a place in heaven but love on earth is more rewarding. Features the voices of Tate Donovan, Danny De Vito, Susan Egan, Rip Torn, Samantha Eggar, Bobcat Goldthwait and Charlton Heston as the narrator.

results.title: Herb Elliott says 'Take five and stay alive'
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Herb Elliott is shown breaking the four minute mile and discussing his training. Just as poor training and condition can cause an injury which will put a runner out for the season, so a faulty motor and bad driving can put a driver and others out, perhaps for life.
results.title_for_label: Herb Elliott says ‘Take five and stay alive’

results.title: Hephzibah
results.brief_description: A documentary about Hephzibah Menuhin, sister of acclaimed violinist Yehudi, who led her own remarkable life. In 1938 when she was eighteen she abandoned a promising career as a concert pianist in the United States to marry Lindsay Nicholas, Australian heir to the Aspro fortune, moving to his remote sheep station. Following the War, Hephzibah toured Europe and had a scandalous affair with Viennese sociologist Richard Hauser. Moved by the horrors of the concentration camps, she became increasingly isolated from her privileged life in Australia. She left her husband and children, married Hauser and settled in London where the couple established their Centre for Human Rights. The documentary utilises archival home movie footage, Hephzibah’s letters and music from her performances to gain insight into the decisions she made throughout her life.

results.title: Henry V: the Battle of Agincourt [study extract]
results.brief_description: Vividly presents the Battle of Agincourt, from Henry V by Shakespeare. The study extract shows the preparations for, and the actual fighting by, both infantry and cavalry with all its noise, colour and confusion.
results.title_for_label: Henry V: the Battle of Agincourt [study extract]

results.title: Henry V [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Sharman, Renaissance Films, BBC and Kenneth Branagh
results.brief_description: Henry V, young king of medieval England, roused his troops to arms against a French army five times greater than themselves. His life and leadership was legendary. From the above story, William Shakespeare wrote one of his greatest plays. Kenneth Branagh, whose stage portrayal of Henry V has been world-acclaimed, made his film directorial debut with this film. Also starring Paul Scofield, Derek Jacobi, Judi Dench and Christian Bale, the film loses none of the power and beauty of Shakespeare’s text.

results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Fred Burnley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Henry Moore
results.brief_description: An analysis of the work of the British sculptor, Henry Moore, and an interview with the artist himself. The film shows, in detail, a number of examples of his work and then follows all stages in the creation of a bronze statue commissioned for the Festival of Britain.
